steps.content: The ğŸš¶ emoji symbolizes walking (and movement in general). However, more broadly, it can represent movement literally and figuratively, from walking to exercise, pacing, hiking, going somewhere, moving, or traveling. The ğŸš¶ emoji's Unicode is U+1F6B6, and its shortcode is :walking: (or :person_walking: on Emojipedia and Discord).

steps.content: Use the ğŸš¶ emoji to discuss taking a walk or walking. Because it depicts a person walking, the ğŸš¶ emojiâ€™s most obvious use is in any texting exchange related to walking. steps.content: Include the ğŸš¶ emoji when mentioning pedestrians or pedestrian areas. Pedestrians include walkers, joggers, and runnersâ€”essentially, anyone traveling by foot rather than by vehicle. steps.title: React to a story involving a walk or hiking.
steps.content: React to a story involving a walk or hiking. If a friend starts texting you about the crazy animal they saw on a hike or their surprisingly peaceful walking tour of the neighborhood, listen to their story and respond based on whatever they say. You might agree that their walk sounded nice, ask where they went, or ask to talk a walk with them sometime, for example. Them : â€œIâ€™m seriously in such a better mood after going on a walk today ğŸš¶â€ You : â€œOh nice, Iâ€™m glad! Did you go anywhere cool or just around the block?â€

steps.title: Ask for more details if someone tells you about their travels.
steps.content: Ask for more details if someone tells you about their travels. When someone mentions a trip they went on (or even a smaller journey, like a trip to the store or the gym for some exercise), try expressing interest and learning more about what they did. You could ask if they had fun, have any pictures, or what the coolest thing they saw was, for example. Them : â€œIâ€™m getting out and seeing the world! ğŸš¶ Starting with a trip to Wales!!â€ You : â€œWow, thatâ€™s so cool! What are you planning on seeing?â€
